query: Pour A, C and D into G,then add E to H.After putting H on G and pouring E from H into G, what happens next?

original_scene.description: A is water. B is a spoon. C is a bottle of red pigment. D is a bottle of citric acid. E is a bottle of baking soda. F is a funnel. G is a transparent glass bottle. H is a balloon.

key_step_1.conclusion: Take appropriate amount of A and C and pour them into G. Use B and F to add appropriate amount of D to G. A can dissolve D and promote the reaction.

key_step_2.conclusion: Use B and F to add an appropriate amount of E to H, and then put H on G. Use B and F to add an appropriate amount of E to H, and then put H on G. Make sure that D and E can react in contact in a closed environment.

key_step_3.conclusion: Pour E from H into G. Since D is acidic and E is alkaline, the two react to produce gas, causing H to expand.

subject: thermodynamics
